alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 28 at 6:48PM MDT until March 30 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT THURSDAY FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS BELOW SNOWPACK AND ALL OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .More widespread critical fire weather conditions will return Thursday. Very strong southwest winds, low relative humidity values, and a high Haines index are expected. Relative humidity values may drop into the single digits for several hours Thursday afternoon. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northeast Plains (Zone 104) and Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) late Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 35 to 45 with gusts near 65 mph on Thursday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values dropping to around 9 to 12 percent Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
